issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: vms-cancellation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62725
226 test runs, 32 test failures, 94 test retries, 86.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62725 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #squad-rte-vms-factor-form or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

One thing to confirm the expected behaviour, when the user goes back to quiz and selecting a different answer, as on initial flow, the default option is preselected based on the answer to the feeding plan type. issues.summary: Implement new attributes in reactivation-bff call
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Clients need to pass two new attributes to the request body of the reactivation-bff call {{reactivation-subscription/reactivate}}:

* {{cadence_start_week}}: should be retrieved from the {{nextModifiableDelvieryWeek}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscriptions}} response.
* {{cadence_interval}}: should be retrieved from the {{endlessPauseInterval}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscription}} response.

Customer impact:

* Cadence interval breaks on reactivation, when reactivation happens within a short period of time after cancellation - issue is reprodicible when reactivation happens on the same day, but it could be longer as well
* Customer is reactivated with a *weekly cadence*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*

Ensure that these fields are correctly passed and handled in the reactivation process.
{panel}

_Issue created in Slack from a_ [_message_|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C09MNFEH6VC/p1763020804905709?thread_ts=1761234939.380539&cid=C09MNFEH6VC]_._

issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Create {{OTPFooter}} component by cloning the existing {{Footer.tsx}} and modifying it for OTP-specific behavior. This maintains consistency in styling and structure while adding OTP-specific redirect logic and reuse the same GTM event fired in the subscription flow ([per the thread|https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C0A3TV1MM5Z/p1767620709913509]).

*Background:*

* OTP footer needs same styling/structure as subscription footer
* Only differences: redirect destination and button state logic
* Cloning ensures visual consistency
* Easier to maintain common styling between both footer

!image-20251202-130556.png|width=1193,height=623,alt="image-20251202-130556.png"!
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

*File to Create:* {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/my-deliveries-components/src/pages/loading-subscription-content/order-confirmation/OTPFooter.tsx}}

*Cleanup required*

# Add OTP-specific imports
# Remove subscription-specific logic
# Update redirectToDashboard function
# Update button props

{noformat}<Button.Primary
Â Â onClick={redirectToOTPDashboard}
Â Â disabled={false}Â //Â ChangedÂ -Â alwaysÂ enabledÂ forÂ OTP
Â Â loading={false}Â Â //Â ChangedÂ -Â neverÂ loadingÂ forÂ OTP
Â Â data-test-id="otp-order-confirmation-CTA"Â //Â Changed
>
Â Â {label}
</Button.Primary>{noformat}
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* OTPFooter.tsx created by copying Footer.tsx
* Subscription-specific imports removed (useQueryClient, useMenuRedirection, etc.)
* Button always enabled (disabled={false})
* Button never in loading state (loading={false})
* Redirects to /my-deliveries/otp
* Clears OTP flag on redirect
* Visual styling identical to original Footer
{panel}

links.summary: [SubscriptionLoading] Integrate OTP Detection and Components in OrderConfirmation

issues.summary: [After Peak] Remove Black Friday fallback logic

issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h1. Description

This task is to establish the experiment for the *Multi Week Discount* voucher attribution variant.

The experiment should:

* Allocate eligible users between the Control & Variant, defined below
* Prevent allocation of ineligible users

h2. The Experiment

The experiment will include *users with no* *_pre-existing or provided_* *attribution code*. This is described as:

* *Provided*: A user that lands on Factor Form with an {{attrCode}} query parameter
* *Pre-existing*: A user that has an existing voucher value in their browser sessionâ€™s {{localStorage}} ({{hf_factorform_voucher}})

h3. Allocation

Eligible users will be allocated between two groups:

* *Control*: BAU Single Box Discount of *40% off* first order (BAU voucher: {{FJ-VMS-40OFF-ONSITE}})
* *Variant*: New Multi Week Discount of *30% off W01, 20% off W02* (new voucher: {{TBD}})
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h1. Acceptance Criteria

h2. Dev Setup / Prerequisites

* CUI discount setting created on staging for a {{box1:30%,box2:20%}} discount, on orders above $65
** for staging setup we will only set the discount to apply to our existing bundle SKUS (other skus wonâ€™t be discounted, just for testing purposes)
* Sample voucher(s) created and attached to this epic for dev usage

h2. Statsig Setup / Requirements

* The A/B test is set up to measure the *uplift* in 5W, 10W, and 52W *retention* (AOR).
* The A/B test is set up to measure the *reduction in monthly cancellation rates*, particularly after the first box.
* The A/B test is set up to measure the *uplift in Customer Campaign Value* (CCV) for cohorts starting with the multi-box discount

h2. Attribution Handler (Dev)

* Eligible users requesting a fallback (onsite/default) voucher application are *allocated*
* Users with a *_pre-existing or provided_* voucher are *not allocated*

*Experience:*

* Control: BAU discount ({{box1:40%}})
* Variant: {{box1:30%,box2:20%}} discount
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
h1. C
